name: lucio/rails Docker container
description: Latest Ruby on Rails on Ubuntu Trusty
readme:
Docker Rails
============

Dockerfile to build an Ubuntu system with Rails on its latest version.

##Specs

 - Ubuntu 14.04 as base OS
 - RVM as Ruby manager
 - Ruby on latest version (2.2.0 right now)
 - Rails on latest version (4.2.0 right now)
 - PostgreSQL on latest version (9.3 right now)
 - Also common packages like nano, curl, etc.
dockerfile:
FROM ubuntu:14.04

# Please, no spam :)
#MANTAINER Lucio MartÃ­nez "luciomartinez at openmailbox dot org"

# Update packages list
RUN apt-get update

# Install common packages
RUN apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
        curl \
        git \
        locate \
        nano

# Install RVM with Ruby and Rails
RUN gpg --keyserver hkp://keys.gnupg.net --recv-keys D39DC0E3
RUN \curl -sSL https://get.rvm.io | bash -s stable --rails

# Add RVM to initial boot applications
RUN echo "" >> /root/.bashrc
RUN echo "# Load RVM" >> /root/.bashrc
RUN echo "source /usr/local/rvm/scripts/rvm" >> /root/.bashrc
RUN echo "" >> /root/.bashrc

# Install PostgreSQL
RUN apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends postgresql libpq-dev

# Generate default admin role passwordless for PostgreSQL
su postgres -c "psql -c \"CREATE ROLE admin SUPERUSER LOGIN;\""

# Remove obsolete packages list
RUN rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

run: apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends         curl         git         locate         nano
